Job Title: Chief Product Officer, Slack

Location: San Francisco, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.

Job Category

Product

Job Details

About Salesforce

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

We are seeking a senior product executive with the ambition, experience, and passion to be our new Chief Product Officer and to lead Product and innovation for Slack. As the CPO, you will be the key executive responsible for formulating and executing a growth-oriented product and business strategy for our product portfolio. This leader will be responsible for a multi-billion dollar business with millions of users and tens of thousands of customers across the globe. These products areas are responsible for driving the productivity and happiness of Fortune 1000+ customers wall-to-wall in every industry.

Slack has a positive, diverse, and supportive culture-we look for people who are curious, inventive, and work to be a little better every single day. In our work together we aim to be smart, humble, hardworking and, above all, collaborative.

What you’ll do: 

Define and execute the Slack strategy to expand category leadership in the overall market and adjacencies; Pursue new addressable markets Work closely with the teams to ensure continued customer success, ACV, revenue, and market share growth Deliver key performance indicators of customer growth, adoption, retention, and expansion across the Slack product portfolio. Partner with other Industry GMs, Engineering, Industry GTM, and business leaders to ensure that the products continue to support and differentiate our overall strategy. Lead the continued growth of the Slack and Salesforce ecosystem with the continuing expansion of our technology in the marketplace. Attract, develop and retain a diverse slate of Product Management leaders around the globe. 

What you should have: 

15+ years of product management and product leadership experience10+ years experience within a software or technology company, preferably managing the product portfolio of the entire business or large business unit. Experience managing the complexity of multiple products serving multiple industries/markets/segments and buyersPassion for Slack and Salesforce, our values, and especially the role the CPO plays in our successA strong sense of vision and ability to mobilize product and teams to continue innovating to drive market leadership and customer successDeep understanding of our markets, how they are evolving, and how Slack can continue to lead in technologiesDemonstrated ability to inspire, align, and enable a large geographically dispersed team across all corporate functions in order to drive a successful business. Understand and believe in the unique characteristics of our approach to developer agility and low code/no-code application development. As equally comfortable discussing platform products for a technical audience as application products for a business user audienceA successful track record of working effectively in a highly matrixed and fast-growing organizationA strong and proven commitment to diversity and equality, building inclusive teams, and inclusive & accessible products Ability to build and grow an outstanding leadership team and organization Portfolio-oriented product approach for balancing bold, high-upside bets with quick wins Demonstrated leadership experience in an enterprise technology organizationProven ability to grow, develop, and retain top product management talentVery strong interpersonal skills, with demonstrated ability to work effectively and collaboratively with diverse team members and external partiesTrack record of driving results within a matrixed business environmentExceptional written/verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate to non-technical and technical audiences with ease

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Posting Statement

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at www.equality.com and explore our company benefits at www.salesforcebenefits.com .

Salesforce is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce .

﻿Salesforce welcomes all.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

For California-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $474,000 to $524,000.

Compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, benefits. More details about our company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
